alert.note: Alert for City and Borough of Sitka (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 23 at 3:01PM AKST until December 23 at 9:00PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...SIGNIFICANT SNOWFALL FOR PARTS OF SE AK THROUGH CHRISTMAS... Multiple frontal bands will pass over the panhandle through the weekend bringing periods of snow. Heavy snow is moving north this afternoon and will be over the northern inner channels tonight. The southern areas have reported from 4 to 8 inches of snow so far with more on the way before becoming a wintry mix or all rain by morning. A break or decrease in snowfall rates remains on track in the morning over the north as the second frontal band tracks into the southern panhandle Saturday morning. This front will continue to move north into the northern areas by the afternoon. This front will bring another round of snow and a chance of freezing rain for the central inner channels with the south changing to all rain through Saturday. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM AKST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches. * WHERE...City and Borough of Sitka. * WHEN...Until 9 PM AKST this evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall rates will begin to decrease this evening and mix with rain overnight.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling.
